column5: Yes I was surprised to see a sign,LIVE BAIT.  On my way to the local bakery,I seen the sign,Live Bait. As I looked,I didnt see much in this little side street mall.  On my way back,I pull into the lot and there is this small little retail shop. Had to check it out.  We have had two in the big city of Barrie,and all have closed up. Crazy thinking were on the big lake of Simcoe,but fishing from shore is not the greatest here,but spring and fall and winter, works the best here.  Just a hop and a skip from the closed up Rack and Reel,the new shop has open up.  The Bait Bucket 230 Innisfil st.  As I walked in,I was greeted very friendly. I wasnt over shocked at the store,as it was just getting underway and is  small,but has that comfort feeling.. Very friendly fella though. It was good to listen and share about buying local,and giving what the locals are looking for (He knew the history of the others). This guy seems to be on the right page IMO He wants to support the angler.. Listen to the customer,and do the best he can. My kinda guy.  I was even up front. If Im saving me gas,or buying on line,I,ll be buying from him. I was straight up. Those that support local Im sure can relate.  I wish Tom all the best here in Barrie.   On a side note. He has a very nice collection of old lures and reels..   AND HAD  MY TWO LUCKY LAKER LURES. I BOUGHTEM UP.
good to see a new one open  did you  grab one of each for  me too  I might have enough equipment installed to give lakers a try on satuday
Since  you put it that way,I,ll share. LOL  I,ll grab a few more for ya bud.

hds 8 and sidescan along with transducers are mounted, just need to tidy put the wires  tracks and crossbeam and downriggers are done, just need to wire them up  front  hds5 and  electric ..well working on them but stuff for lakers first  old honda hooked up and steering rod to main motor working  darn near good to go....come on long week end
Anybody know if this shop is up and running?
Been open for a while,visited a few times myself already.
Haven't been in, but will be once the ice gets here.
think he's open around 6 every day.
Thx---I tried to find a phone #, no luck.
Thx---I tried to find a phone #, no luck. 705-737-2248
Drove by it a week ago last Monday and it was wide open.  He was a sponsor for the Barrie Fall Fishing and I think there was a write up about  him in the Examiner (read it on line) as well.  Michael
Thanks for the heads up Brian. I'll pass the info along to my brother who I'm sure will stop by.

Phoned them and went and bought Pautskes Fire Cure. Thx for posting the info, Brian. (Something's gotta break myjinx with the bows LOL)  The owner, Tom, was quite friendly and helpful. I'll go there again.
